result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Skill, Fees, and Equilibrium AUM ** A manager can generate **α = 1.3%** per year up to **$486m** of capital; above that, incremental α ≈ 0. The fund charges **1%** on total AUM. Assume investors flock in until **net α = 0**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Equilibrium AUM
Dollar alpha at capacity: α × capacity = 1.3% × $486m = $6.32m per year.
At equilibrium, investors add capital until **dollar α = fees**:
fee × AUM = 1% × AUM = $6.32m ⇒ AUM = $632m (rounded).
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Fee revenue at equilibrium
Fee revenue = fee × AUM = 1% × $632m = $6.32m per year.
Notice this equals the manager’s **dollar α at capacity**: $6.32m. Intuition: competition drives **net α to investors ≈ 0**; skilled managers capture the rents via fees.
::: :::
